verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician <S%H5329><s%> on Neginoth <S%H5058><s%> upon Sheminith, <S%H8067><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> rebuke <S%H3198><s%> me not in your anger, <S%H639><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> chasten <S%H3256><s%> me in your hot <S%H2534><s%> displeasure. <S%H2534><s%>
Have mercy <S%H2603><s%> on me, O LORD; <S%H3068><s%> for I am weak: <S%H536><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> heal <S%H7495><s%> me; for my bones <S%H6106><s%> are vexed. <S%H926><s%>
My soul <S%H5315><s%> is also sore <S%H3966><s%> vexed: <S%H926><s%> but you, O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how <S%H5704><s%> long? <S%H5704><s%>
Return, <S%H7725><s%> O LORD, <S%H3068><s%> deliver <S%H2502><s%> my soul: <S%H5315><s%> oh save <S%H3467><s%> me for your mercies' <S%H2617><s%> sake. <S%H4616><s%>
For in death <S%H4194><s%> there is no <S%H369><s%> remembrance <S%H2143><s%> of you: in the grave <S%H7585><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> shall give you thanks? <S%H3034><s%>

I am weary <S%H3021><s%> with my groaning; <S%H585><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the night <S%H3915><s%> make I my bed <S%H4296><s%> to swim; <S%H7811><s%> I water <S%H4529><s%> my couch <S%H6210><s%> with my tears. <S%H1832><s%>
My eye <S%H5869><s%> is consumed <S%H6244><s%> because of grief; <S%H3708><s%> it waxes old <S%H6275><s%> because of all <S%H3605><s%> my enemies. <S%H6887><s%>

Depart <S%H5493><s%> from me, all <S%H3605><s%> you workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity; <S%H205><s%> for the LORD <S%H3068><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my weeping. <S%H1065><s%>
The LORD <S%H3068><s%> has heard <S%H8085><s%> my supplication; <S%H8467><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will receive <S%H3947><s%> my prayer. <S%H8605><s%>
Let all <S%H3605><s%> my enemies <S%H341><s%> be ashamed <S%H954><s%> and sore <S%H3966><s%> vexed: <S%H926><s%> let them return <S%H7725><s%> and be ashamed <S%H954><s%> suddenly. <S%H7281><s%>
